posts.author: DzmitryB
posts.content:
While PW where I play is temporarily not working, I came here to ask another dumb question or maybe to start another discussion.

In NWN there are a lot of possibilities to build a ranged character.
Divine archers, Zen archers, AA based archers, rogue/assassin archers with SA/DA, even dev.critting archers, also crossbow and throwing weapon builds and more...
But which are the most powerful?
Most easier to play?
Which are best for solo play and which only in party?
Which shine at early levels and which are killing machines in late 30s?
And a lot of other questions.

Thanks for your suggestions as always.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
That's a lot of questions Dzmitry.
AA is by far the most OP archer class and enables many of the different build types that you list above.
Some of them are not really any good without the boost to AB and/or damage from the AA class.

Tactical options, versatility and a sound defense make the best solo archers. Typical glass cannon builds work better in parties.

I will not point at any build in particular  because what works for me doesn't necessarily work for you. That has to do with preferred play style and the module design where you play.

I have made a guide for archers with focus on the AA class where I describe these things more in depth.

posts.author: kfor85
posts.content:
I've leveled quite a few archers/spellbows to lvl 40 on WoG solo: Wiz/SD/AA, Dr/Wiz/AA, Sor/Cl/AA and so on.

What I've experienced that makes them possible to solo is their access to summons to do the dirty job tanking in combination with crowd control spells like Greases, Darknesses, SoVs, Bigby's line of spells etc.

In some cases where INT is the primary casting attribute I had enough skill points to add Deadly Trap handling to my repertoire, another strong asset for a solo artist.

So summing it up, for solo play spellbows with access to 9th level spells (sprinkle some Epic Warding/Dragon Shape/whatever strong epic spell/feat you want to play around) and a mundane AB around 40 are not killing machines at level 40 per say, but really strong toons to adapt in pretty much every situation I've encountered at the mid magic environment of WoG.

Your mileage may vary according to magic levels, arrows available, if Greater Magic Weapon can be cast on bows/arrows etc

Cheers!
